explanation: Equivalent EMF for parallel combination is <katex>$E_{eq} = \frac{\frac{E_1}{r_1} + \frac{E_2}{r_2}}{\frac{1}{r_1} + \frac{1}{r_2}}$</katex>.
This is a weighted average of <katex>$E_1$</katex> and <katex>$E_2$</katex> based on conductance (1/r).
The value will lie between <katex>$E_1$</katex> and <katex>$E_2$</katex>. Since <katex>$r_2 > r_1$</katex>, the conductance <katex>$1/r_1 > 1/r_2$</katex>.
The equivalent value will be closer to the source with the lower internal resistance (<katex>$E_1$</katex>).
